page.title: 03EDUCATION CENTRE
page.content: The Llansannan Education Centre,Canolfan Addysg Bro Aled,was opened in April 1967 to replace the old Llansannan controlled school.It was the first of its kind in the western part of Clwyd then known as Denbighshire.Since then it has been a hub of activity every night except Sunday. The centre is financially supported by the Clwyd County Council receiving aa annual rent from the organizing committee.This comprises of two representatives from each of the fifteen member societies,and each organisation has free use of the centre for an annual minimum contribution of Â£15.00.The centre is appreciated to such an extent that the societies sometimes donate up to Â£100;this being the proceeds of a single event such as a local concert.
